alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fond du Lac; Sheboygan; Washington (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 12:27PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, in east central Wisconsin, Fond du Lac and Sheboygan. In southeast Wisconsin, Dodge and Washington. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Beaver Dam area has seen the most rain with amounts of 2.5 to 3.5 inches so far. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fond Du Lac, Beaver Dam, Waupun, Mayville, North Fond Du Lac, Horicon, Juneau, Lomira, Campbellsport, Theresa, Hustisford, Oakfield, Elkhart Lake, Iron Ridge, Southern Lake Winnebago, Burnett, Taycheedah, Ashford, Lamartine and Byron. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Fond du Lac; Sheboygan; Washington
